DrugInfoMetaData.DrugInfoDescription: Elacestrant dihydrochloride is a type of hormone therapy called a selective estrogen receptor degrader (or SERD). It binds to the estrogen receptor, causing it to be destroyed. This stops the growth of cancers that need estrogen to grow.

Section.Title: Use in Cancer
Section.Para: Elacestrant dihydrochloride is approved to treat:

ItemizedList.ListItem: Breast cancer that is estrogen receptor (ER) positive and HER2 negative, has a mutation (change) in the ESR1 gene, and has spread. It is used in postmenopausal women and in men whose cancer has gotten worse after at least one type of hormone therapy.

Section.Para: Elacestrant dihydrochloride is also being studied in the treatment of other types of cancer.
